title: Schadenfreude (Harm Enjoyment Signals)
description: Detects items where positive affect language co-occurs with harm, punishment, or humiliation language in the same item. This is evidence display: it does not infer intent, motivation, or character.

supports: Identifying repeated instances where positive affect co-occurs with harm-related language within the collected dataset.
Quantifying frequency and distribution of harm-positive language across time and threads.
does_not_support: Inferring intent, motivation, or psychological traits.
Predicting real-world behavior or likelihood of action.
Claiming completeness beyond the collected dataset and declared surfaces.
failure_modes: Sarcasm or ironic phrasing may be misclassified without additional context.
Quoted text may be misread as endorsement if attribution context is not present in the item.
Harm references without explicit harm terms may be missed (false negatives).
epistemics.scope_statement: All results are limited to observable content in the collected dataset and declared surfaces for this run.

inclusion_rules.description: Positive affect language co-occurs with harm/punishment/humiliation language within the same item body.

exclusion_rules.description: Exclude items where harm is referenced in an explicitly condemning frame (conservative exclusion).

value: \\b(this is wrong|not ok|stop (doing|saying)|i don't condone|that's messed up|shouldn't)\\b

metrics.title: Harm-positive items
metrics.description: Number of items that meet the inclusion criteria after exclusions.

metrics.title: Rate per 100 items
metrics.description: Harm-positive count normalized per 100 items in the analyzed scope.

metrics.title: Over-time distribution
metrics.description: Temporal distribution of harm-positive items (e.g., monthly bins).
